intro: Minuartia velenovskyi, commonly known as the Velenovsky's sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, and its succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to arid environments. Native to regions of Central Asia, this species thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous areas. It is a perennial plant that produces numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and delicate species in its native range.
